summary: This is an internal email chain from August 16, 2019, between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing a follow-up related to the SEC and Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reference Epstein's death by strangulation the morning after a call and a query about whether he was investing other people's money.

persons.name: Cowley
persons.context: Appears as a sender/recipient in the email chain discussing SEC registration and Epstein's death. Mentions receiving a call about 'Epstein stuff' and following up on records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in the email chain regarding his death by strangulation and a question about whether he was investing other people's money, which relates to SEC registration.

connections.description: Cowley is following up on records related to Epstein's financial activities, specifically whether he was investing other people's money, as part of an SEC inquiry.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by strangulation in his jail cell the morning after a call with US Attorney's Office personnel.

events.title: Email discussion on SEC and Epstein
events.description: Internal email chain among USANYS personnel discussing the SEC's failure to register as an Investment Adviser case and following up on Epstein's financial records.

keyFacts: The email chain references Jeffrey Epstein's death by strangulation occurring 'the morning after our call' with US Attorney's Office personnel.
There is an ongoing SEC investigation into whether Epstein was required to register as an Investment Adviser, specifically whether he was investing other people's money.
The correspondence indicates the Epstein matter had fallen down the priority list after his death but was being revisited.
The emails are internal communications within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) from August 16, 2019.
